poem:
Title: "A Measure of Life in Dog Years"

In the gaunt wake of dawn's light,
The long-nosed whippet dreams
Of time's tender curve extended.

No brutish extinguishment awaits her,
Rather a journey layered in years -
A tribute to her diminutive being.

While the bulldog, heavy and flat-faced,
Finds mortality clipped, running short of breath.
Genetics reminding: we are not all granted the same.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Small, long-nosed dog breeds live longer, study reveals Every dog has its day – but some clock up more years than others. Now research has revealed that when it comes to longevity, small, long-nosed breeds are top dog, while flat-faced ones are more at risk of an early death. Once size, face shape and sex were taken into account researchers found that overall small, long-nosed female dogs tended to have the longest lifespans among pure". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
